title: SodaOak
author: SodaOak
content: Most of my fund is on XRP and I am a long time believer of this project, price could dump more bit I care less for now because 2025 is my main target, now I oy care about keep the coins safe, Is XRP and XRP ledger working on your hardware wallet?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: There are reputed open source hardware wallet that support ripple, like Trezor. This is Trezor official website if you want to order Trezor hardware wallet directly from the company: https://trezor.io/

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: i have stored xrp on my ledger nano s at one time.i don't hold it any more but to answer ur question, yes it is supported.edit: come to think of it, i think i still have $10 worth of it stuck on my ledger.

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: SodaOak on October 13, 2022, 03:16:06 PMMost of my fund is on XRP and I am a long time believer of this project, price could dump more bit I care less for now because 2025 is my main target, now I oy care about keep the coins safe, Is XRP and XRP ledger working on your hardware wallet? Just like others who posted above me, I never stored any XRP on ledger. Two of the hardware wallets that I know where you can secure and store your XRP are Ledger and SecuX. For Trezor, I'm not sure if XRP is supported.This post should be on Altcoin board I guess.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: I have 2 Safepal S1 hardware wallets. They are bit challenging to use, but they WILL hold all kinds of diff coins securely.https://www.safepal.com/coin/listscheers

comments.body: nowadays hardware wallets keep improving because there is competition there. So not just XRP but the other chains as well can be stored on a hardware wallet. but i were you im staking the XRP   so when 2025 arrived the coin add little bit

I really do hope that XRP would worth the sacrifice in the future because there seems to be a fundamental issue with that project that has warranted SEC going after the project. I pray they scale through the process and come back stronger.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Almost most Hardware wallets (when bitcoin is supported XRP is) support Ripple, so your question should be in the comparison between these wallets more than searching for which of these wallets are safer, better priced, and other details.As for shipping, Ledger Nano X and Nano S Plus gives free shipping limited[1] offer and you may get discounts on Black Friday.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5416646.0

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: You won't anything to worry about if it's on a hardware wallet like Ledger wallet(Live) and Trezor. Both have good reputation in the community and they're both supporting XRP deposits.For your peace of mind, look at their respective websites supported altcoins and tokens.https://trezor.io/coins/https://www.ledger.com/supported-crypto-assets

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: SodaOak on October 13, 2022, 03:16:06 PMMost of my fund is on XRP and I am a long time believer of this project, price could dump more bit I care less for now because 2025 is my main targetYou are accepting risk with XRP because its future depends on result of their lawsuit with SEC. Recent months, it seems we have seen some positive news but the lawsuit is still not finished. So we are still in uncertain situation about future of XRP. I wish you luck but why did you put most of your fund in XRP?Ethereum, Binance BNB are safer coins for you to choose if you love altcoins. A more safer coin is Bitcoin.I don't take risk like you. If I want to invest in XRP, I will wait for final result of lawsuit and even so it won't be too late for me to buy XRP.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Trezor and Ledger are trustworthy hardware wallet and have a high security to secure your coins from hacking incident, online attack etc. But it can't prevent if the developer want to freeze your coins! XRP is centralized and the developer can freeze your coin in your own hardware wallet [1], which mean it doesn't make your coin are 100% secured. You need to think twice if you really want to hold XRP for long time.[1] https://bitcoinist.com/not-decentralized-ripple-freezes-1m-user-funds/

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: dansus021 on October 14, 2022, 01:14:35 AMnowadays hardware wallets keep improving because there is competition there. So not just XRP but the other chains as well can be stored on a hardware wallet. but i were you im staking the XRP   so when 2025 arrived the coin add little bitThat is really contradictory opinion though since OP actually intend to hold the coin under his own possession with extremely high security as possible that is why he chose hardware as an option meanwhile staking is more likely giving out the funds to another platform and expect small returns even if we earn from it there is also risk associated with it which is we may lose the funds completely in case something like hack or rugpull.To OP as suggested trezor and Ledger Nano supports XRP so you can choose anyone from it for the long term cold storage.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: It's better to store XRP in a hardware wallet like Ledger Nano S, Trezor, Safepal, SecuX, etc., that supports this crypto. Don't ever count too much on storing XRP in centralized exchanges and even non-custodial wallets that were created online. Investing in a hardware wallet is the key to ensure that your funds are safe from hackers and intruders, especially XRP. One of the best investment that you'll ever need to make sure that your funds aren't compromised and having full custody of it.

comments.body: Quote from: SodaOak on October 13, 2022, 03:16:06 PMMost of my fund is on XRP and I am a long time believer of this project, price could dump more bit I care less for now because 2025 is my main target, now I oy care about keep the coins safe, Is XRP and XRP ledger working on your hardware wallet?
